mapper.sql: INT_ID, NAME, BBU_NO, LONGITUDE, LATITUDE, BTS_NAME, BSC_NAME, BTS_ID, CIRCUITROOM_OWNERSHIP, TRANS_OWNERSHIP, VENDOR_BTSTYPE, CITY_ID, COUNTY_ID, RELATED_BTS, IS_SHARE, BBU_TYPE, RELATE_WYBTS, MANUAL_FLAG, DELETE_FLAG, DELETETIME, UPDATETIME,DELETE_RESONCODE,DELETE_TEXT

u.INT_ID, u.NAME, u.BBU_NO, u.LONGITUDE, u.LATITUDE, u.BTS_NAME, u.BSC_NAME, u.BTS_ID, u.CIRCUITROOM_OWNERSHIP, u.TRANS_OWNERSHIP, u.VENDOR_BTSTYPE, u.CITY_ID, u.COUNTY_ID, u.RELATED_BTS, u.IS_SHARE, u.BBU_TYPE, u.RELATE_WYBTS, u.MANUAL_FLAG, u.DELETE_FLAG, u.DELETETIME, u.UPDATETIME,u.DELETE_RESONCODE,u.DELETE_TEXT
mapper.update:
update WY_BBU
MANUAL_FLAG = #{manualFlag,jdbcType=DECIMAL},
DELETE_RESONCODE = #{deleteResoncode,jdbcType=DECIMAL},
DELETE_TEXT = #{deleteText,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
1=1
and INT_ID=#{intId,jdbcType=DECIMAL}
and delete_flag=#{deleteFlag,jdbcType=DECIMAL}
mapper.select:
select city_id,count(1) num from wy_bbu
delete_flag=0 and is_share=0 and bbu_type in(1,2)
and manual_flag=#{manualFlag}
group by city_id order by city_id
